intro: Rungia caespitosa, commonly known as the red-rooted spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant has dark green, oval-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellow flowers. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often turning red when mature, which gives it its common name. Rungia caespitosa is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
